originalText.text: This residential looks nice like four ⭐️ hotel. I met the front desk Mr.  Eddie a honest and good person. Give me very good impression towards this place. Good working staff raise value of the company. I enjoy the time of staying here—from jing zhao A volunteer art promoter

originalText.text:
I am thrilled to write this 5-star review in appreciation of the phenomenal service provided by the building management team at West 96th Apartments. In the two years that I have been a resident, their unwavering dedication to excellence has exceeded my expectations at every turn.

From the moment I moved in, the management team has shown remarkable friendliness and professionalism, always making me feel welcome and well-taken care of. They are highly responsive, addressing any issues or concerns with a sense of urgency that demonstrates their commitment to their residents' satisfaction.

The range of tasks they handle is truly impressive, from utilities to glass breakage and leakage problems. Their adept problem-solving skills and attention to detail have put my mind at ease, allowing me to fully enjoy my living experience without any worries.

Thanks to the outstanding service provided by the West 96th Apartments' management team, I can now focus on what truly matters to me, knowing that my home is in the best possible hands. I wholeheartedly recommend West 96th Apartments to anyone seeking a top-notch living experience with a management team that genuinely cares about their residents' well-being.

text.text:

originalText.text: The concierge staff are very friendly while juggling many different responsibilities in an efficient way including the distribution of packages and any number of other requests. The service and maintenance  staff are very skilled and professional and always responsive. This is a well-run building because of the efforts of all of these folks. A bonus is being a block from the magnificent Central Park!

text.text: The concierge staff are very friendly while juggling many different responsibilities in an efficient way including the distribution of packages and any number of other requests. The service and maintenance  staff are very skilled and professional and always responsive. This is a well-run building because of the efforts of all of these folks. A bonus is being a block from the magnificent Central Park!

originalText.text: While claiming to be a luxury building they are anything but. The only positives are a nice lobby, the doormen and the apartment layouts. We have lived in the building for 12 years now and the services are declining year after year, especially since Equity Residential took over: Cheaper and cheaper appliances, worse and worse services (we had to wait two weeks to get the dishwasher fixed),  ugly cheap non-matching yellow replacement tables that look liked they came from a yard sale, non-working barbecues and no-working lights. These non-working rooftop lights are a mystery. During the winter they are on all the time. However, during the summer they are switched off when it gets dark. The whole thing feels like Equity does anything they can to prevent you from enjoying the rooftop while being able advertise that they have one to lure you in.

These non-working rooftop lights are a mystery. During the winter they are on all the time. However, during the summer they are switched off when it gets dark. The whole thing feels like Equity does anything they can to prevent you from enjoying the rooftop while being able advertise that they have one to lure you in.

originalText.text:
I constantly smell cigarette smoke, my neighbors blast loud music. All this has gone unaddressed by management. I received a renewal offer for close to $5,000 for a one bedroom apartment which I thought was incredibly steep. I submitted notice to leave because I thought that was way too high. This morning I looked at what my unit was listed for and it's $400/month less. Which of course leads me to believe that if you complain like I did your rent will be raised. Completely unfair and disgusting. Avoid this
building.
